subject: Programming
title: The Cost of Late Bug Fixes
description: A 60-second lesson on The Cost of Late Bug Fixes.

hook.text: Finding a bug during design costs $1 to fix. Finding it in production costs $100.

buildup.text: IBM's research showed that bug-fix costs grow exponentially the later they're discovered.

discovery.text: A typo caught in code review takes minutes. The same typo in a live system takes an emergency team.

twist.text: Despite knowing this, most companies still skip early testing to ship features faster.

climax.text: The cheapest bug fix is the one that never ships. Prevention always beats repair.

punchline.text: Every shortcut now becomes an emergency later.

quiz.question: How do bug-fix costs change as software moves toward production?
